B2 [ C or U ] the act of looking at or considering something carefully in order to discover something: a post-mortem examinationhave an examination I had to have a medical examination when I joined the pension scheme.under examination The evidence is still under examination (= being examined).on closer examination I thought it was paint at first, but on closer examination I realized it was dried blood.
A2 [ C ] formal an exam
More examplesFewer examplesThe doctor has made an initial diagnosis, but there'll be an additional examination by a specialist.Forensic examination revealed a large quantity of poison in the dead man's stomach.I had to strip down to my underwear for my medical examination.We took a sample of the river water back to the laboratory for examination.Careful examination of the plane revealed minute cracks in the fuselage and wings.
